xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9" xmlns:ns2="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9 http://www.loc.gov/ead/ead.xsd">arc_264_1698_kings_county_censusGuide to the Facsimile of 1698 Kings County census ARC.264Collection processed by Nicholas PavlikThis collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.Brooklyn Historical SocietyBrooklyn Historical Society128 Pierrepont StreetBrooklyn 11201718-222-4111library@brooklynhistory.orgThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2017-03-30T20:35:22Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content StandardMarch 2017
Last updated by John Zarrillo
Brooklyn Historical Society
Facsimile of 1698 Kings County census
Bittner, Franklin
Oakley, Earnest A.
ARC.264
1.25 Linear Feet in one oversize box.
1698 Facsimile of a broadside containing the first census of Kings County, N.Y., recorded in 1698. The census lists the residents of each of Kings County's six original towns, including Brooklyn, Bushwick, Flatbush, Flatlands, Gravesend, and New Utrecht. Residents of the towns of Newtown and Flushing in Queens County are also listed. Coats of arms of prominent Kings County families are shown along the border of the broadside. A note on the verso indicates that the facsimile was created by Franklin Bittner. A00340
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Facsimile of 1698 Kings County census, ARC.264, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Earnest A. Oakley, 1959.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Processing Information
Broadside was flattened and sleeved in Mylar by John Zarrillo in March 2017.
Broadsides (notices) Census records Kings County (N.Y.) |v Census, 1698 Queens County (N.Y.) Oakley, Earnest A.
